definitions.text: an actor who plays villainous roles
a serious (or tragic) role in a play
of comparatively great physical weight or density
unusually great in degree or quantity or number
of the military or industry; using (or being) the heaviest and most powerful armaments or weapons or equipment
examples: heavy industry involves large-scale production of basic products (such as steel) used by other industries

definitions.text: marked by great psychological weight; weighted down especially with sadness or troubles or weariness
usually describes a large person who is fat but has a large frame to carry it
(used of soil) compact and fine-grained
examples: the clayey soil was heavy and easily saturated

definitions.text: darkened by clouds
of great intensity or power or force
(physics, chemistry) being or containing an isotope with greater than average atomic mass or weight
(of an actor or role) being or playing the villain
examples: Iago is the heavy role in `Othello'

definitions.text: permitting little if any light to pass through because of denseness of matter
of relatively large extent and density
made of fabric having considerable thickness
prodigious
full and loud and deep
examples: a herald chosen for his sonorous voice

definitions.text: given to excessive indulgence of bodily appetites especially for intoxicating liquors
of great gravity or crucial import; requiring serious thought
examples: faced a grave decision in a time of crisis
the weighty matters to be discussed at the peace conference

definitions.text: slow and laborious because of weight
examples: the heavy tread of tired troops
moved with a lumbering sag-bellied trot

definitions.text: large and powerful; especially designed for heavy loads or rough work
dense or inadequately leavened and hence likely to cause distress in the alimentary canal
sharply inclined
full of; bearing great weight
requiring or showing effort
examples: the subject made for labored reading

definitions.text: characterized by effort to the point of exhaustion; especially physical effort
examples: worked their arduous way up the mining valley
spent many laborious hours on the project

definitions.text: lacking lightness or liveliness
(of sleep) deep and complete
in an advanced stage of pregnancy
slowly as if burdened by much weight
examples: time hung heavy on their hands
